events.text: Here, President Ronald Reagan drafts his 1985 inaugural address.
events.title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging

events.text: In 1989, President George H.W. Bush spoke on the phone about the United States’ invasion of Panama.
events.title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging

events.text: Archival photographs show presidents in the study undertaking the daily tasks of leading the free world .
events.title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging

events.text: In the Trump era, the room has changed .
events.title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging

events.text: Now, it looks almost like a miniature version of the gift shop at a Trump property .
events.title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging

events.text: David Hume Kennerly/Getty Images This small, private room in the White House, known as the Oval Office study, has witnessed decades of history.
events.title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging

events.text: Archival photographs show presidents in the study undertaking the daily tasks of leading the free world.
events.title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging

events.text: Now, it looks almost like a miniature version of the gift shop at a Trump property.
events.title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging

events.text: President Trump doesn’t spend much time in the study working.
events.title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging

events.text: But he takes foreign leaders there to show off the goods, including hats that reference a third term.
events.title: A Tiny West Wing Office Is Big on Trump Messaging

combined_summary: The Oval Office study, known as the Oval Office Study, has witnessed decades of history . In the Trump era, it looks almost like a miniature version of the gift shop at a Trump property . President Trump doesn't spend much time in the study working, but he takes foreign leaders there to show off the goods .
story_reconstruction:
Headline:  The Oval Office study, known as the Oval Office Study, has witnessed decades of history . In the Trump era, it looks almost like a miniature version of the gift shop at a Trump property . President Trump doesn't spend much time in the study working, but he takes foreign leaders there to show off the goods .


Timeline:
- 1985-11-01: Here, President Ronald Reagan drafts his 1985 inaugural address.
- 1989-11-01: In 1989, President George H.W. Bush spoke on the phone about the United States’ invasion of Panama.
- 2025-11-14: Archival photographs show presidents in the study undertaking the daily tasks of leading the free world .

Turning points:
- 1985-11-01 — Here, President Ronald Reagan drafts his 1985 inaugural address.
- 1989-11-01 — In 1989, President George H.W. Bush spoke on the phone about the United States’ invasion of Panama.
- 2025-11-14 — Archival photographs show presidents in the study undertaking the daily tasks of leading the free world .
